author: DarkLordMakuta
title: Toa Mahri Hewkii
review: This set is awesome! Sure, it's kinda short and a bit asymmetrical, but the mask is cool and unique, and the weapon and shoulder blades are cool as heck, and, with practice, the Cordak blaster is quite efficient.

author: Republic_Commando_Sev
title: Awesomness!
review:
This set is awesome! Just look at those shoulder blades! And the Cordak Blaster and the Staff! The blades give him a very cool look! The only thing I don't like are the Chains! The mask is cool! I like how the Cordak Blaster is connected to his arm! It makes it look thick so he can hit people!
Republic Commando Sev

author: Vorahk1Panrahk2
title: Almost Decent
review:
Hewkii used to be the Toa Mahri I wanted most out of the collection. Now that I've seen him, I have to say my opinion has changed. 

You are all familiar with the canisters, and how they are difficult to open, but there is something else about Hewkii's canister. It was very well done, and the combination of the black and yellow on it look amazing. However, the set is nothing like this. The colors don't flow that well, and Hewkii reminds me more of a walking/talking caution sign. 

The Build is relatively simple. The only area I imagine anyone would have trouble is with attaching the Cordak blaster, or twisting the pipe the way you want it to go. Even then, they are pretty simple tasks. 

There are a few parts of the design, though, that, to be honest, fail. The shoulder mounted blades (while looking cool on that canister picture and on the set) make positioning the arm really awkward, as they keep running into Hewkii's head. The other issue is with the upper leg armor (the mace pieces). They look very out of place, and don't fit the water environment he's supposed to be in (why would you want weights attached to your legs?). Ditto for the chains, which serve no purpose.

One thing people may complain about is the backwards torso. However, after reversing it, I realize that it looks just as, if not more, strange than it's current configuration (the shown neck is a tad awkward looking).

I've had more fun with the Cordak blaster than any other projectile since the Kanoka disks (which simply means more fun than Rhotuka and Zamor). The Cordak don't fall out when the launcher is moved, and they shoot far. They're a bit hard to fire when attached to a figure, but this is a minor detail, when it can just be taken off.

There is one downside to the blaster. It's that it makes the set a bit side-heavy. I don't know if all the sets are like this or if it's just mine, but this makes the set unstable with standing, and has to be carefully positioned to keep it standing. Again, this may just be my set. 

As far is playing with Hewkii, he does seem like he would be fun to play with, as he has a cool spear and a nice blaster. I don't really play with sets anymore, but I'm sure someone who does would have fun with this guy. 

It's easy to tell that Lego was trying to be original with this guy. Different thigh armor, new way of attaching  blaster, and shoulder blades all point to this fact. However, between the blades and the pointless chains, I must say it didn't work out to well. This is why Hewkii went from most wanted, to not decent. I'd give him a 3.5 if I could, but since he isn't a 4, I had to score as a 3.

author: shima55
title: He's OK
review:
Hewkii is a fairly decent Toa Mahri but I am glad he isn't the first one I got.

Pros:
Hewkii has an amazing selection of pieces.
These pieces are in very good colors.
His new Kanohi and tools are good.
With practice, the Cordak Blaster is effective.
Leg armor is good.
Chains are awesome.

Cons:
Lacks chest armor.
He is awfully short.
His bladed shoulder makes posing difficult.
The fact that he has no right hand looks very odd.

Overall, I think Hewkii is a good set, but I wouldn't get him as my first Toa Mahri.

author: reidak49
title: okay
review: the cordak is fun but dont hit very hard the cool blades and leg armor are spike great for MOCing (my own creation) the shoulder blades i dont like the mask its not connected to the mouth and he is short but he is great so buy him

author: witzenHammer
title: pretty cool, but what's up with the wasted plastic parts.
review:
Hewkii is cool. pretty wicked looking even if the the shoulder blades conflict with the masks winged flange shape.

Blaster is way to heavy for this guy's joints. It would seem his long handled blade is there only to make him hold a standing position when holding the gun.  Gun works easier than the squid shooter I guess.  Love the feet.

But What is the deal with the packaging?  Sure it looks cool and makes you want to buy it, but, what a waste of resources to make the sculpted plastic frame around this package. It would be justifiable if there were more than the couple peg holes it has. All LEGO needs to do is put some of the cross holes, more pin holes, or some studs, then it could be incorporated into MOC's in some sort of way, or used to stand them up, but this is just a huge plastic hunk of uselessness.

chains

author: Gus_263
title: Water warrior
review: Small, but no than kongu, with awesome weapons hewkii is a great warrior. The two chains, two blades, and the aqua war blade, very used in some sets, a great blade to creations. The cons: he don't have armors on his arms, only the two blades. The cordak is heavy and the legs short. The arms aren't the same, but the really problem is that they are big. Other pros: The armors of legs looks like very for a diver. The mask is cool if used with dive systems.

author: SaintElsewhere
title: Very neat.
review: Hewkii is my only Toa Mahri and he makes me think I should buy more. The best things about him are the staff, mask and chains. I love having him and Ehlek get into a fight and try to short each other out. The mask is also very good, and I like the numerous spikes and blades used in the design.

review:

pros:

I think this set is really cool 4/5

author: PaulTR
title: Not the Hewkii We Know and Love
review:
My brother had bought the Inika version of Hewkii, and I liked him so much, I decided to purchase Hewkii's Mahri version. However, my experience with him almost made me not want to buy his fellow Toa. While Hewkii does have some good things going for him, he also has quite a few negatives.

 

Hewkii is not a very good looking Toa. With his oddly shaped mask, asymetrical body, and his lack of armor, Hewkii is probably the strangest looking Mahri as well. Another problem is there are too many attachments on Hewkii: he has 2 blades on one shoulder, bright red Cordak ammo on the other, chains on his arms, a Cordak blaster in one hand, and spiked knee caps. I think the designers tried too hard to make him seem like a tough, multi-weapon weilding Toa. Even his color scheme is confusing: he has black legs, silver weapons, yellow arms, red spikes, and a very annoying blue axel/rod underneath his head. Honestly, the only remotely cool thing about him is his mask; it vagualy reminds me of a stingray. Also, he is probably the most unique looking Toa (although "unique" also ryhmes with "freak") But besides this, Hewkii is a total bust in the looks department.

 

Hewkii's build is pretty standard, and not very different from previous years. His body is composed of Piraka and Inika pieces, and is supplemented by some silver weaponry. Overall, Hewkii was a pretty easy build. However, Hewkii does have some good pieces: new silver knives, his war blade, a new tube piece, and an interesting mask. Also, he has 2 chains and a pair of spiked Technic pieces. So, at least Hewkii is not a complete bummer with his included pieces.

 

However, Hewkii really falters in the playability field. This comes from the fact that his right arm is limited in movement by his 2 shoulder knives. Also, his Cordak blaster cannot be moved very much due to the lack of a hand piece on his right hand. As another disapointment, the Cordak blaster is slightly hard to fire. Mercifully, its much easier to use than the Barraki's squid launcher. And as far as poseability goes, the less said about it, the better. Since he has less articulation than other Toa, his poseability options are very low. As far as his 9.99 US dollars, I'll just say this: I find it hard to justify. Well, lets check out the facts, and see if we can scrounge up some good things for Hewkii:

 

Pros:

  • -Plenty of useful pieces
  • -Interesting mask
  • -Unique look
  • -Tons of silvery weapons

Cons:

  • -Not very cool looking
  • -Too asymetrical
  • -Boring build
  • -Cordak hard to fire
  • -Less articulation than other Mahri
  • -Poseability options limited

So, should you get Hewkii? Well, that depends. If you just want to get one or two Mahri, I would NOT recommend Hewkii. However, if you already have three or four Mahri already, you should pick him up. Yes, he has some serious issues. However, he does look good with the other Mahri, and at least you can take him apart for some good pieces :/

author: tkettle9719
title: Huw vs. Hewkii: An Epic Matchup of Indecisions!
review:
I got this set from my mom after a 5th grade graduation (Americans aren't always the brightest), and is one of my favorite Bionicle sets ever.

Pros

  • -The color scheme of yellow and black still looks cool- Black 'n' Yellow!
  • -The use of an oxygen tube through the mask is genius.
  • …

Cons

  • -This guy is a bit short compared to the rest of the team, but he still looks awesome.
  • -The loss of an arm on the blaster side, the lack of torso armor, it all makes me sad.
  • …

This is an excellent set overall, and it has the great details of an awesome set. I highly recommend this set, but MOCers should keep this set and upgrade it.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Toa Mahri) - Toa Hewkii Review
review:
This is a cool figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Parts

This set has 62 pieces and it was 10 USD when it was on sale. That means that the price per piece ratio was 16 cents per piece which is a really good value for what we get here.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8912-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be adjusted. On one hand we can see a turret and on the other hand we can see a staff. On both hands we also get a chain. The only two things which I don't like about this set is that the turret doesn't really work and that the box can be messed up very easily if you want to open it.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: Johnsmith1235
title: This bionicle is awsome!
review:
I got this BIONICLE brand new and sealed for fairly cheap, considering some of the other prices on Ebay, 79.99 and up.

 This is one of the Toa Mahri, Toa Hewkii (one I or two?). He is very cool and unique with awsome weapons.

Pros

  • Unique mask
  • Very cool Cordak launcher
  • Nice staff/blade weapon
  • Awsome spiked leg armor
  • Chains on arms looks cool
  • Blades on shoulder also look cool (even if they do limit movement).

Cons

  • Lacks armor on chest and arms
  • Cordak weapon only fires if pushed fairly hard and fast
  • Blades on shoulder limit arm movement (slightly)

 

Some people would tag Hewkii's mismatched arms as A con, but that is not A problem for me.

This set is really worth it and I would reccomend it! It can be found on Ebay for sure.

author: Nmfrey23
title: Don't ask him if he needs a hand...
review:
So, I like the Toa Mahri, and Hewkii is no exception. However, I'd certainly say that his build is the most flawed. Still, the set is wildly unique due to the colours used, the new parts (especially the mask), and the rest of his amazing weirdness.

Pros:

.Eye-catching colours 

.Introduces new weapons and a cool flattened mask design

.Cordak blaster (works well most of the time)

.Unique armour choice

Cons: 

.Colors are nothing like any of the past Hewkii sets 

.Head can't move well due to the mask he wears

.Blades on his right shoulder can limit movement of that arm, as well as his head

.This doesn't really bother me, but this set lacks a right hand

Overall, I still really like this set despite its flaws, and I'd recommend it regardless.

3/5
